intro: Senecio luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It features slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
